org.itemscript.core.values
Interface JsonAccess

All Known Subinterfaces:
JsonArray, JsonContainer, JsonItem, JsonObject, JsonSystem
All Known Implementing Classes:
ChainObject, ItemscriptContainer, ItemscriptItem, ItemscriptSystem
public interface JsonAccess

Provides access to contained JsonValue by string locators, which may be keys in the case of JsonContainer classes, or URLs in the case of JsonItem or JsonSystem classes. For compatibility with the Map and List interfaces, the simple get, put, and remove methods on this class are named getValue, putValue, and removeValue. Implementing classes should add get, put, and remove methods compatible with Map and List as appropriate for their interface.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Method Detail

dereference

JsonValue dereference(java.lang.String key)
Dereference a value under the given key.

If the value is a JsonString, the string is treated as a URL and retrieved.

If the value is a JsonContainer, the value itself is returned.

If the value is of any other type, an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
key - The key used to find the value to dereference.
Returns:
The dereferenced value.

dereference

void dereference(java.lang.String key,
                 GetCallback callback)
Dereference a value under the given key, asynchronously, calling the supplied callback when it returns.

If the value is a JsonString, the string is treated as a URL and retrieved.

If the value is a JsonContainer, the value itself is returned.

If the value is of any other type, an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
key - The key used to find the value to dereference.
callback - The callback to call when the dereference operation completes.

getArray

JsonArray getArray(java.lang.String key)
Get a JsonArray value. If the element does not exist or is not an JsonArray, returns null.

Parameters:
key - The key used to find the value.
Returns:
The JsonArray, or null if it did not exist or was not a JsonArray.

getBinary

byte[] getBinary(java.lang.String key)
Get a binary value. If the element does not exist or is not a JsonString, returns null. If the value is a string but cannot be base64-decoded, throws an exception.

Parameters:
key - The key used to find the value.
Returns:
The binary value, or null if it it did not exist or was not a JsonString.

The Long value, or null if it did not exist or was not a JsonString.

getValue

JsonValue getValue(java.lang.String key)
Get a JsonValue. If the value does not exist, returns null.

This method is named "getValue" to avoid conflicts with the List and Map "get" methods. A method named "get" will be provided by any class implementing this interface, and that method should be used instead of this one, for brevity.

Parameters:
key - The key used to find the value.
Returns:
The value, or null if the value did not exist.

put

JsonBoolean put(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Boolean value)
Put a boolean value as a JsonBoolean.

Parameters:
key - The key to put the value under.
value - The boolean value to store.
Returns:
The new JsonBoolean.

put

JsonString put(java.lang.String key,
               byte[] value)
Put a binary value. The value will be base64-encoded and stored in a JsonString.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Parameters:
key - The key to put the value under.
value - The binary value to store.
Returns:
The new JsonString.

Parameters:

value - The double value to store.

putValue

JsonValue putValue(java.lang.String key,
                   JsonValue value)
Put a JsonValue.

Note that the return from this method is the value that was returned from the put operation, which differs from the Map.put(K, V) method which returns any previous value that the map had under that key.

Care should be taken when using the JsonObject put method which has the Map put behavior; it is not interchangeable with this putValue method because of the different return values; if you don't care about the return value, there is no difference.

The put methods on JsonSystem and JsonItem are interchangeable with this method.

Parameters:
key - The key to put the value under.
value - The JsonValue to store.
Returns:
The JsonValue returned by the put operation, which may not be the same value that was given to store.

removeValue

void removeValue(java.lang.String key)
Remove a value.

This method is named "removeValue" to avoid conflicts with the List and Map "remove" methods. A method named "remove" will be provided by any class implementing this interface, and that method should be used instead of this one, for brevity.

Parameters:
key - The key indicating the value to remove.
